item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "...my house contains every useless thing in the world. it lacks only the one essential, a piece of sky like this one..." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "...the memory of a particular image is but regret for a particular moment.." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Clarice Lispector
item.description: "I only achieve simplicity with enormous effort" -- Clarice Lispector

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Clarice Lispector
item.description: "Who has not asked himself at some time or other: am I a monster or is this what it means to be a person?" -- Clarice Lispector

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Clarice Lispector
item.description: "Things were somehow so good that they were in danger of becoming very bad because what is fully mature is very close to rotting" -- Clarice Lispector

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "...the City is what they want it to be: thriftless, warm, scary and full of amiable strangers. No wonder they forget pebbly creeks and when they do not forget the sky completely think of it as a tiny piece of information about the time of day or night." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "the hopelessness that comes from knowing too little and feeling too much (so brittle, so dry he is in danger of the reverse: feeling nothing and knowing everything)" -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "A son ain't what a woman say. A son is what a man do." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "What's the world for you if you can't make it up the way you want it?" -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Enrique Vila-Matas
item.description: "La vida es demasiado breve como para vivir el número suficiente de experiencas, es necesario robarlas." -- Enrique Vila-Matas

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Enrique Vila-Matas
item.description: "Y me sentí un transeúnte más que un día sería un transeúnte menos" -- Enrique Vila-Matas

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Nicolás Guillén
item.description: "...la pureza de quien no llegó a ser lo suficientemente impuro para saber qué cosa es la pureza. " -- Nicolás Guillén

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Enrique Vila-Matas
item.description: "la vida es corta pero el día largo" -- Enrique Vila-Matas

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "And talking about dark! You think dark is just one color, but it ain't. There're five or six kinds of black. Some silky, some woolly. Some just empty. Some like fingers. And it don't stay still, it moves and changes from one kind of black to another. Saying something is pitch black is like saying something is green. What kind of green? Green like my bottles? Green like a grasshopper? Green like a cucumber, lettuce, or green like the sky is just before it breaks loose to storm? Well, night black is the same way. May as well be a rainbow." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Jaime Sabines
item.description: "Tú sabes cómo te digo que te quiero cuando digo: "qué calor hace", "dame agua", "¿sabes manejar?", "se hizo de noche"...Entre las gentes, a un lado de tus gentes y las mías, te he dicho "ya es tarde", y tú sabías que decía "te quiero"." -- Jaime Sabines

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Jaime Sabines
item.description: "¿Es que hacemos las cosas sólo para recordarlas? ¿Es que vivimos sólo para tener memoria de nuestra vida? Porque sucede que hasta la esperanza es memoria y que el deseo es el recuerdo de lo que ha de venir." -- Jaime Sabines

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Juan Rulfo
item.description: "Cada suspiro es como un sorbo de vida del que uno se deshace." -- Juan Rulfo

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Juan Rulfo
item.description: "La muerte no se reparte como si fuera un bien." -- Juan Rulfo

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Juan Rulfo
item.description: "Vivimos rompiendo nuestro mundo a cada rato..." -- Juan Rulfo

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Juan Rulfo
item.description: "Yo sé cómo le brillaban antes los ojos como si fueran charcos alumbrados por la luna. Pero de pronto se destiñeron, se le borro la mirada como si la hubieran revolcado en la tierra." -- Juan Rulfo

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Juan Rulfo
item.description: "Pero los caminos de ella eran más largos que todos los caminos que yo habia andado en mi vida y hasta se me ocurrió que nunca terminaría de quererla." -- Juan Rulfo

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Juan Rulfo
item.description: "Y ustedes y yo y todos sabemos que el tiempo es más pesado que la más pesada carga que puede soportar el hombre." -- Juan Rulfo

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "But when one believes in the reality of things, making them visible by artificial means is not quite the same as feeling that they are close at hand." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "No doubt very few people understand the purely subjective nature of the phenomenon that we call love, or how it creates, so to speak, a supplementary person, distinct from the person whom the world knows by the same name, a person most of whose constituent elements are derived from ourselves." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The laborious process of causation which sooner or later will bring about every possible effect, including, consequently, those which one believed to be least possible, naturally slow at times, is rendered slower still by our desire (which in seeking to accelerate only obstructs it), by our very existence, and comes to fruition only when we have ceased to desire, and sometimes ceased to live." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Our desires cut across one another, and in this confused existence it is rare for happiness to coincide with the desire that clamoured for it." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "I was left alone there in the company of the orchids, roses and violets, which, like people waiting beside you who do not know you, preserved a silence which their individuality as living things made all the more striking, and warmed themselves in the heat of a glowing coal fire..." -- Marcel Proust
